#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=IX

#Text=A whirlwind of dust , scorching down the road , suddenly broke into violent diffuse masses ; and Demetrio 's army emerged , a chaos of horses , broad chests , tangled manes , dilated nostrils , oval , wide eyes , hoofs flying in the air , legs stiffened from endless galloping ; and of men with bronze faces , ivory teeth , and flashing eyes , their rifles in their hands or slung across the saddles .
#Text=Demetrio and Camilla brought up the rear .
#Text=She was still nervous , white-lipped and parched ; he was angry at their futile maneuver .
#Text=For there had been battles , no followers of Orozco 's to be seen .
#Text=A handful of Federals , routed .

#Text=A poor devil of a priest left dangling from a mesquite ; a few dead , scattered over the field , who had once been united under the archaic slogan , RIGHTS AND RELIGION , with , on their breasts , the red cloth insignia : Halt !
#Text=The Sacred Heart of Jesus is with me !
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=One good thing about it is that I 've collected all my back pay ,  Quail said , exhibiting some gold watches and rings stolen from the priest 's house .

#Text= It 's fun fighting this way , " Manteca cried , spicing every other word with an oath .

column1: #Text=" You know why the hell you 're risking your hide . "
#Text=In the same hand with which he held the reins , he clutched a shining ornament that he had torn from one of the holy statues .
#Text=After Quail , an expert in such matters , had examined Manteca 's treasure covetously , he uttered a solemn guffaw .
#Text=" Hell , Your ornament is nothing but tin ! "
#Text=" Why in hell are you hanging on to that poison ? " Pancracio asked Blondie who appeared dragging a prisoner .
#Text=" Do you want to know why ?

#Text=" Hey you ... what are you gobbling about ?

#Text= Hurry up , ' Pifanio , " said the man who was smoking , " the sun has gone down already and you have n't taken the animals to water . "

column1: #Text=A horse neighed outside the corral ; both men glanced up in amazement .
#Text=Demetrio and Camilla were looking over the corral wall at them .
#Text=" I just want a place to sleep for my woman and me , " Demetrio said reassuringly .
#Text=As he explained that he was the chief of a small army which was to camp nearby that night , the man smoking , who owned the place , bid them enter with great deference .
#Text=He ran to fetch a broom and a pail of water to dust and wash the best corner of the hut as decent lodging for his distinguished guests .
#Text=" Here , ' Pifanio , go out there and unsaddle the horses . "
#Text=The man who was shelling corn stood up with an effort .
#Text=He was clad in a tattered shirt and vest .
#Text=His torn trousers , split at the seam , looked like the wings of a cold , stricken bird ; two strings of cloth dangled from his waist .
#Text=As he walked , he described grotesque circles .
#Text=" Surely you 're not fit to do any work ! " Demetrio said , refusing to allow him to touch the saddles .
